intro: Glossopetalon spinescens, commonly known as the spiny glossopetalon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a rough, textured surface. Glossopetalon spinescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas.
